The country that suffered the most total casualties in WW2 was generally accepted as the USSR but it has recently been discovered that Stalin ordered special units to remove the ID discs from dead Red Army soldiers to make reported losses lower than those actually sustained but he also added all those who died in the Gulags, starved to death as a result of his policies or who were just executed as being undesirable. So like so many things the official figures from the USSR are suspect. I would suspect that China suffered the highest total of war casualties because they had been fighting the Japanese for at least a decade before WW2 proper began. There are only some very rough estimates for the numbers of Chinese civilians killed as a result of Japanese occupation and military casualties were almost impossible to confirm.
